Container.Name: pinchy-dash
Container.Overview: Pinchy Dashboard — A modern monitoring dashboard for your OpenClaw AI agent. Tracks tokens, costs, sessions, goals, calendar, chat, and agent health.
Container.Description: Pinchy Dashboard — A modern monitoring dashboard for your OpenClaw AI agent. Features: token/cost tracking, session history, chat with your agent, goal management, content planning, learning log, calendar sync, and real-time agent health status. Connects to your OpenClaw Gateway for chat and calendar features.

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Port for the Pinchy Dashboard web interface.

Config.Name: Dashboard Data
Config.Description: Stores dashboard config, chat history, goals, learning entries, and other persistent data.

Config.Name: OpenClaw Data Path
Config.Description: Path to your OpenClaw data directory on the host. Mounted read-write so you can edit agent files (IDENTITY.md, soul.md) from the dashboard.

Config.Name: Calendar Data Path
Config.Description: Path to vdirsyncer calendar data on the host (e.g. /mnt/user/appdata/openclaw-calendars). Run: docker exec OpenClaw find /root/.local/share/vdirsyncer -type d -name calendars to find it. Leave empty if not using calendar.

Config.Name: OpenClaw Gateway URL
Config.Description: URL of your OpenClaw Gateway (e.g. http://192.168.0.53:18789). Leave empty to configure via the web UI onboarding wizard instead.

Config.Name: OpenClaw Gateway Token
Config.Description: Auth token for your OpenClaw Gateway. Found in your OpenClaw config under gateway.auth.token. Leave empty to configure via the web UI.

Config.Name: Dashboard API Key
Config.Description: Optional. If set, write API endpoints (goals, content, learning, settings) require this key as a Bearer token. Leave empty for no protection (fine for local network use).

Config.Name: OpenClaw Sessions Path
Config.Description: Path to OpenClaw session files inside the container. Only change this if your OpenClaw uses a non-standard sessions directory.

Config.Name: Debug Mode
Config.Description: Set to 1 to enable Flask debug mode with auto-reload. Leave at 0 for production.
